definition: desolate/unfrequented/to treat sb coldly/to snub/to cold shoulder
surname Leng
cold
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
The courtyard is deserted, you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
pinyin: men2 ting2 leng3 luo4 , men2 kan1 luo2 que4

sentences.english: Jack got the cold shoulder from his classmates after he double-crossed his best friend.
sentences.chinese: 自从杰克出卖了他最好的朋友后，同班同学都冷落他。

sentences.english: We decided to go the other route, and we're going to tell you who all got snubbed .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定反过来说，我们会告诉大家谁被冷落。

sentences.english: And those who dared to gainsay the wisdom of the fathers were shunned by all decent people.
sentences.chinese: 谁否定先人的智慧，谁就会遭到正派人的冷落。

sentences.english: She felt slighted because her friends didn't telephone her.
sentences.chinese: 她的朋友没有给她打电话，她觉得受到冷落。

sentences.english: Poor Alice, she always seems to be left out in the could at parties.
sentences.chinese: 阿丽丝真可怜，她在聚会上似乎总是受冷落。

sentences.english: One sweet, now cold, I lost or abandoned by you.
sentences.chinese: 当初旳甜蜜，现在旳冷落，是莪丢失还是妳遗弃。

sentences.english: Seeing her beloved owner leave, she also feels gloomy, neglect others, and huddle up in a corner, unanimated.
sentences.chinese: 学会了冷落人，她蜷在小角落里，无精打采的。

sentences.english: The criminal was prescribed to one poor solitary place.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯被限制在一个贫穷冷落的地方。

sentences.english: He was slighted in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 他被冷落在屋里的角落。

sentences.english: She felt she was snubbed here.
sentences.chinese: 她感到她在这里受到了冷落。

sentences.english: Elizabeth was left out in the dancing party.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白在舞会上受到了冷落。

sentences.english: Comparatively, handles c in the link net's service actually relatively to receive desolately .
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，在联通办理c网的业务却相对收到冷落。

sentences.english: Adouble-snub for this raw slum classic.
sentences.chinese: 这部描写贫民窟原生态的经典影片被两次冷落。

sentences.english: Were Leland and Jane Stanford snubbed by the president of Harvard University?
sentences.chinese: 斯坦福夫妇是否被哈佛大学校长冷落？

sentences.english: More than two months of disdain and cold, really regret of the table.
sentences.chinese: 两个多月的不屑与冷落，真的该表表歉意了。

definition: to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
a cold reception/to cold-shoulder sb
to lose favor/in disfavor/disgraced
to dote on sb
to spurn/to reject
cold/indifferent
to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
sarcastic comments (idiom)/to make sarcastic comments
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
to be suspicious and jealous of
(old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
depressed/cheerless
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to receive favor (from superior)/favored/pampered
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
